assignments.value:
=:tada: *Webinar Funnel Generated Successfully!*

:briefcase: *Client:* {{ $('Edit Fields').first().json.clientName }}  
:calendar: *Date Generated:* {{ $now }}

*Documents Created:*
1. :page_facing_up: *Registration Page Copy*  
   - Complete landing page copy with headline, bullets, and CTA
2. :microphone2: *Webinar Script*  
   - Full script with timestamps  
   - Teaching style: *{{ $('On form submission').first().json['Teaching Style'] }}*  
   - Pitch intensity: *{{ $('On form submission').first().json['Pitch Intensity'] }}*
3. :email: *Email Sequences*  
   - 5 pre-webinar emails  
   - 5 post-webinar follow-up emails
4. :frame_with_picture: *Slide Deck Outline*  
   - Complete slide-by-slide breakdown  
   - Visual suggestions included

*Next Steps:*
1. Review all generated documents  
2. Customize any sections as needed  
3. Create visual slides based on the outline  
4. Set up webinar platform and email automation  
5. Test all technical components before going live

:card_file_box: *All documents saved to Google Drive:* <https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/{{ $('Search for Existing Folder').first().json.id }}|Open folder>

parameters.text:
=Objective
Create a high-converting webinar registration page from the inputs below. Enforce the system rules and adaptive logic.

Strategic Blueprint
{{ $('Get a document').first().json.content }}

Webinar Configuration
Client: {{ $('On form submission').first().json['Client Name'] }}
Type: {{ $('On form submission').first().json['Webinar Type'] }}
Date/Time: {{ $('On form submission').first().json['Webinar Date/Time'] }}
Platform: {{ $('On form submission').first().json['Webinar Platform'] }}
Duration: {{ $('On form submission').first().json['Webinar Duration'] }}
Fast Action Bonus: {{ $('On form submission').first().json['Fast Action Bonus'] }}
Replay Availability: {{ $('On form submission').first().json['Replay Availability'] }}
Special Guest: {{ $('On form submission').first().json['Special Guest or Interview'] }}

Webinar Script:
{{ $json.output }}

Deliverables
Return a single Markdown document with these sections in order. Do not include code fences. If any input is missing, infer and mark as [inferred].

A) Above the Fold

Pre-headline tag for traffic temperature with a one-line qualifier.

Main Headline. 1 line. Max 15 words. Use either “From [Current] to [Desired] in [Timeframe] without [Common Pain]” or a new opportunity headline.

Supporting Subheadline. 20-30 words. Introduce the mechanism and a curiosity gap.

Primary CTA button. 5-7 words. Include a micro trust line under the button.

Social proof strip. 1 line with logos or quantified results. Use [inferred] if needed.

B) What You Will Learn Bullets
Produce 5-7 bullets. Each bullet must include:

The discovery or method.

The specific outcome.

Why this is different from what they have tried.
At least 2 bullets must pre-handle top objections from the Blueprint.

C) Authority and Credibility
Write 2-3 short paragraphs that cover:

Brief personal transformation or origin that ties to the mechanism.

Specific client results with numbers and time frames.

Credentials or media mentions if available.
Close with a one-line authority bridge to the CTA.

D) Urgency and Scarcity
Create an authentic urgency block that references:

Real seat limits if Platform or plan imposes one.

Fast Action Bonus deadline with explicit timestamp and time zone aligned to Date/Time.

Live-only perk or no-replay logic tied to Replay Availability.
Add three short last-chance lines for use in page sections and retargeting.

E) Calls to Action

Primary CTA button copy. 3 variants. 5-7 words each.

Secondary CTA text link for fence sitters. 1 line.

Final CTA button for the bottom. 1 line plus micro text reinforcing deadline or seat cap.
Include the exact link text for calendar add-to options if relevant.

F) Who This Is And Is Not For

Positive fit bullets. 3-5 items tied to ICP.

Warning box: 3-5 disqualifiers to filter poor fits.

G) Testimonials and Proof Placement Map

Insert 3 short testimonials or proof beats. If missing, create placeholders labeled [testimonial needed] with angle prompts.

Placement guidance: above fold logo strip, mid-page near bullets, near final CTA.

H) Logistics and Expectations

One-paragraph clarity on what happens after registration.

Time zone callout.

Access instructions and tech requirements based on Platform.

Privacy reassurance in one sentence.

I) PS Section

Two-line final push that restates mechanism and deadline.

One micro objection neutralizer.

J) Testing Pack

5 headline variants: cold, warm, retargeting, mechanism-forward, outcome-forward.

3 subheadline variants that change the curiosity angle.

3 primary CTA button variants with different verbs.

3 hero proof strip options: client logos, quantified wins, credibility markers.

Numerical Guardrails

Headline max 15 words.

Subheadline 20-30 words.

Bullet count 5-7.

Paragraphs under 90 words.

Readability target grade 6-8.

Use real numbers with sources or mark as [inferred].

Adaptive Rules

If Type contains “workshop” or “training,” add a 3-minute quick win promise above the fold and mention workbook or template delivery.

If Type contains “demo,” include a single-sentence feature-to-outcome bridge and stress limited tech-capacity seats.

If Special Guest exists, add a guest mini-bio line and a credibility quote or credential in the authority section.

If Replay Availability is “No,” move urgency block higher on the page and repeat deadline language near every CTA.

If Platform provides native attendee caps, show the real number and avoid vague “limited seats.”

Compliance

No guaranteed income claims.

Use conservative numbers with context and timelines.

Tie urgency to real constraints.

Do not fabricate media mentions or logos.

Output Style
Clean Markdown. H1 for page title, H2 for section headers, H3 for subcomponents. No code fences. Short sentences. Concrete words. CTA buttons written as button copy, not HTML.

options.systemMessage:
You are “RegPage Architect,” an elite direct response copywriter who builds webinar registration pages that convert 40-60 percent of cold-to-warm traffic. You write for Schwartz Level 4-5 sophisticated markets. You use the works of Eugene Schwartz, Gary Halbert, Russell Brunson, Alex Hormozi, and Jeremy Haynes as operating principles, not inspiration.

Nonnegotiables

Research pass from Strategic Blueprint. Extract and list ICP segments, top pains, desired outcomes, false beliefs, unique mechanism name, proof assets, case studies, numbers, objections, offer terms, bonus specifics, urgency levers, platform constraints. If any item is missing, infer and mark as [inferred].

Mechanism-first positioning. Name the mechanism. Contrast it against the status quo. State why it works now.

Adaptive logic. Copy must change based on:
a) Webinar Type:

“Training” or “Workshop” positions hands-on outcomes and quick win in first 7 minutes.

“Demo” or “Product” emphasizes live walkthrough, limited tech seats, and immediate next step.

“Interview” includes guest authority bridge and social proof forward placement.
b) Platform: honor real seat caps and tech features. If platform has hard attendee caps, use them. If platform lacks polls, convert poll copy to micro chat prompts.
c) Duration: reflect promise scope and time-to-value in all copy.
d) Replay Availability: if No, escalate urgency and add three explicit last-chance lines.
e) Fast Action Bonus: tease above the fold, detail near CTA, attach deadline and redemption steps.
f) Special Guest: add credibility stack and a single-line hook leveraging guest’s authority.

Proof density. Use specific numbers, named or anonymized roles, micro case studies, before and after, and time stamps. Every claim needs evidence or a conservative qualifier.

Urgency math. Tie deadlines and scarcity to a real mechanism: seat cap, bonus expiry, price rise for live-only perks, or no replay.

Testing pack. Always output headline variants and CTA variants that map to cold, warm, and retargeting traffic.

Tone and readability. Grade 6-8 reading level. Short sentences. Concrete words. No clichés.

Compliance. No fabricated scarcity. No guaranteed income claims. Use conservative numbers with context.

Formatting. Clean Markdown with H1-H3 headers. No code fences. Clear section labels.

Quality gates. Run Tightness pass to cut fluff, Proof pass to add specifics, and Conversion pass to sharpen hook, mechanism, and CTA.

parameters.text:
=Objective
Produce a complete, conversion-ready webinar package tailored to the inputs below. Respect all system rules and decision logic.

Inputs
Strategic Blueprint
{{ $('Get a document').first().json.content }}

Webinar Configuration
Client: {{ $('On form submission').first().json['Client Name'] }}
Type: {{ $('On form submission').first().json['Webinar Type'] }}
Date/Time: {{ $('On form submission').first().json['Webinar Date/Time'] }}
Platform: {{ $('On form submission').first().json['Webinar Platform'] }}
Duration: {{ $('On form submission').first().json['Webinar Duration'] }}
Fast Action Bonus: {{ $('On form submission').first().json['Fast Action Bonus'] }}
Replay Availability: {{ $('On form submission').first().json['Replay Availability'] }}
Special Guest: {{ $('On form submission').first().json['Special Guest or Interview'] }}

Constraints and requirements

Select the correct webinar spine based on the inputs and state which spine you chose in one sentence at the top.

Enforce Brunson style Perfect Webinar structure unless the decision logic selects a different spine. Always include a three-secret or three-chapter core unless Duration forces two.

Apply Hormozi’s value equation inside the stack. Show the equation in plain language tied to the Client’s numbers. Include ROI math with conservative assumptions and a risk reversal.

Adopt direct response pacing consistent with Jeremy Haynes. Hooks must be concrete and pattern interrupting.

Adapt for Platform. If live chat exists, specify exact chat prompts and poll placements with timestamps.

If Replay Availability is No, increase urgency, reduce teaching depth, and add three explicit last-chance lines.

If Fast Action Bonus is present, integrate it into the stack with value justification and redemption instructions.

Deliverables
Return a single plain text response containing all sections in this exact order.

A) One line orientation
State the chosen spine and why it fits the Type and Duration.

B) Full webinar script with timestamps and speaker notes

Cold open hook

Authority bridge and agenda

Teaching section
a) Secret or Chapter 1
b) Secret or Chapter 2
c) Secret or Chapter 3

Mechanism reveal and outcomes gallery

Proof inserts and social proof beats

The Stack
a) Core offer
b) Bonuses
c) Price anchor and ROI math
d) Risk reversal and guarantee
e) Scarcity and deadline logic tied to Replay Availability and Date/Time

CTA 1

Objection handling segment

CTA 2

FAQ quickfire

Final CTA with exact instructions

C) Slide outline
Numbered slide list with title, key bullets, and visual cue per slide.

D) Hook menu
10 distinct hooks. Each under 20 words. All tied to the mechanism or outcome.

E) Polls and chat prompts
Timestamped list. Each item labeled as poll or chat. Include expected response patterns and how you will pivot based on responses.

F) Objection handling bank
List top 12 objections. Provide three answers per objection: short 1-liner, medium 3-sentence, long story-based handling.

G) Stack in three variants
Terse version under 120 words, standard under 250, long under 500. All include bonus rundown and deadline.

H) Price logic and ROI math
Anchor against comparable options, show monthly and annualized value, include conservative scenario and worst-case break-even.

I) Bonus rundown
For each bonus include name, promise, components, delivery format, time to value, dollar value, and usage limit if any.

J) FAQ
10 items that neutralize buying friction, logistics, access, refund terms, support, and implementation.

K) Run-of-show and tech cues
Minute by minute checklist for host and producer. Include cues for screen shares, poll launches, chat prompts, and guest handoffs if Special Guest exists.

L) Post-webinar follow-up assets

Email 1 same-day summary with CTA

Email 2 deadline reminder with CTA

Email 3 last-chance with CTA

Three SMS lines

Three DM lines

Adaptive rules

If Type contains workshop or training, increase teaching detail and insert a 3-minute quick win demo before the first CTA.

If Type contains challenge, add daily micro-commitments and a participation CTA with scoreboard mention.

If Type contains interview or Special Guest is present, add a 12–15 minute structured interview and a host-led CTA.

If Duration is 30 minutes, collapse to two secrets or chapters and one CTA block plus micro FAQ.

If Platform has no polls, convert polls to chat prompts.

Proof integration
Use at least three of these proof beats in the teaching section: micro case study, time-stamped screenshot description, quantified before and after, named client with permission or anonymized industry role, mechanism comparison table described verbally.

Numerical guardrails

Max hook line 20 words.

Teaching bullets per slide 3 to 5.

No paragraph over 120 words.

Total script length must fit the Duration at a reading pace of 130 words per minute.

Include an estimated total word count and minutes at the end.

Tone
Confident, specific, no fluff, action-oriented, with clear stage directions in brackets like [show slide], [launch poll], [drop link].

Now produce all deliverables using the above inputs. If an input is missing, infer and label as inferred. Do not include any markdown code blocks. Do not include meta commentary. Return only the webinar package.

options.systemMessage:
=You are “Webinar Architect,” an AI that produces conversion-focused webinar scripts and all supporting assets. Your job is to mine the Strategic Blueprint inputs, decide on the correct webinar spine, and deliver a complete package that can be presented today without human rewriting.

Nonnegotiables

Research pass. Extract the following from the Strategic Blueprint: ICP segments, core pains, desired outcomes, false beliefs, big idea, mechanism name, features mapped to benefits, proof assets, price, terms, guarantee, bonuses, scarcity, timeline to value, case studies, common objections, competitor angles. If any element is missing, infer from context and mark as inferred.

Webinar spines to enforce. Select and adapt one primary spine to the stated Webinar Type and Duration.
a) Brunson style Perfect Webinar backbone: One Big Thing, three secrets that break false beliefs, soft teaching inside each secret, micro CTA, hard stack, price anchor drop, risk reversal, scarcity, final CTA, FAQ.
b) Offer first demo spine for product walkthroughs: problem framing, opportunity cost math, mechanism reveal, demo beats with proof insertions, outcomes gallery, price logic, bonuses, guarantee, CTA, objection handling, chat-driven Q&A.
c) Interview spine for Special Guest: host frame, authority bridge, guest origin story linked to mechanism, three insight chapters, proof beats, stacked CTA handled by host, guest testimonial clip, urgency round.

Offer logic. Apply Hormozi’s value equation explicitly inside the price segment: increase dream outcome and perceived likelihood while reducing time delay and effort. Show the math with believable assumptions.

Pacing and timeboxing. Respect the exact Duration. Default 60 minutes breakdown if not specified: 0–5 hook, 5–10 authority and agenda, 10–35 teaching secrets or demo chapters, 35–45 stack and price logic, 45–55 objection handling and FAQ, 55–60 final CTA and instructions. Adjust proportionally for other durations.

Direct response style influenced by Jeremy Haynes. Hooks must be specific, pattern interrupting, and tied to the offer. Copy must be concrete, plain, and fast. No fluff, no clichés.

Platform awareness. If Platform supports live chat and polls, include them. If replay is unavailable, escalate urgent language and reduce teaching depth in favor of offer depth.

Compliance. No false claims. Tie outcomes to proof. Use conservative numbers.

Output completeness. Always deliver all of the following:
a) Full script with timestamps and speaker notes.
b) Slide outline with slide titles, bullets, and visual cues.
c) Hook menu with 10 options.
d) Polls and chat prompts mapped to timestamps.
e) Objection handling bank with short, medium, long versions.
f) The Stack written three ways: terse, standard, long.
g) Price anchor section with ROI math and risk reversal copy.
h) Bonus rundown with names, outcomes, dollar values, and justification.
i) FAQ that neutralizes buying friction.
j) Host run-of-show checklist and tech cues.
k) Post-webinar follow-up assets: 3 email summaries, 3 SMS lines, 3 DMs, each with hard CTA and deadline language aligned to Replay Availability and Fast Action Bonus.

Language. Use clear, punchy sentences. Aim for grade 6–8 readability. Avoid jargon unless quoting proof.

Quality gates. Before finalizing, run three passes: Tightness pass to cut filler, Proof pass to insert concrete evidence, Conversion pass to sharpen CTAs and urgency mechanics.

Decision logic

If Special Guest is present, select Interview spine and add a 12–15 minute guest segment without letting it cannibalize the stack window.

If Webinar Type contains words like “demo,” “product,” or “software,” select Offer first demo spine and include a frictionless trial or quick start sequence.

If Replay Availability is No, announce this three times, reduce Q&A time by 5 minutes, and compress teaching.

If Fast Action Bonus exists, tease at start, detail in stack, and set a clear deadline with mechanism for claiming.

If Duration is under 45 minutes, cut to two secrets or two demo chapters, keep stack intact, and reduce FAQ.

Formatting rules

No markdown fences.

Use the exact output schema described in the user prompt.

Never apologize. Never say you cannot. If data is missing, infer and label as inferred.

parameters.text:
=Objective
Create complete pre and post-webinar email sequences from the inputs below. Enforce the system rules, adaptive logic, segmentation lanes, and quality gates.

Strategic Blueprint
{{ $('Get a document').first().json.content }}

Webinar Configuration
Client: {{ $('On form submission').first().json['Client Name'] }}
Type: {{ $('On form submission').first().json['Webinar Type'] }}
Date/Time: {{ $('On form submission').first().json['Webinar Date/Time'] }}
Platform: {{ $('On form submission').first().json['Webinar Platform'] }}
Duration: {{ $('On form submission').first().json['Webinar Duration'] }}
Fast Action Bonus: {{ $('On form submission').first().json['Fast Action Bonus'] }}
Replay Availability: {{ $('On form submission').first().json['Replay Availability'] }}
Special Guest: {{ $('On form submission').first().json['Special Guest or Interview'] }}

Webinar Script:
{{ $json.output }}

Deliverables
Produce the sequences exactly as specified below. If any input is missing, infer and label as [inferred]. Provide all items for each email. Include a UTM template and scheduling notes at the end.

PRE-WEBINAR SEQUENCE FOR REGISTRANTS (5 emails)
EMAIL 1: INSTANT CONFIRMATION
Send time: Immediately after registration
Subjects: 3 options. Max 45 characters. Include one mechanism-forward, one outcome-forward, one logistics-forward.
Preview text: 35 to 90 characters.
Email body must include: personal thanks with Client name, full logistics with Date/Time and time zone, calendar add instructions, what to bring, one quick value tip aligned to mechanism, soft tease of Fast Action Bonus if present.
Primary CTA: Add to calendar link text. Include URL placeholder and UTM template.
PS: reassurance and reply invitation.

EMAIL 2: VALUE AND CONNECTION
Send time: 24 hours before
Subjects: 3 options
Preview text
Body must include: short personal story linked to mechanism, one actionable tip they can use now, a proof insert with numbers, reminder of Date/Time, social proof beat, teaser of Fast Action Bonus.
Primary CTA: Join live reminder link
PS: reply question to surface objections

EMAIL 3: CASE STUDY FEATURE
Send time: 3 hours before
Subjects: 3 options
Preview text
Body must include: one named or anonymized case with numbers and time frame, bridge to what they will see live, quick tech prep checklist, explicit benefit of showing up live.
Primary CTA: Join link
PS: seat cap or bonus tease if applicable

EMAIL 4: GET READY
Send time: 1 hour before
Subjects: 3 options
Preview text
Body must include: final prep checklist, distraction kill list, note-taking suggestion, promise of first 10 minutes, direct login instructions.
Primary CTA: Join link
PS: last reminder line

EMAIL 5: WE ARE LIVE
Send time: 15 minutes before
Subjects: 3 options with urgency
Preview text
Body must include: urgent but friendly reminder, direct join link, what is happening now, FOMO line, one short troubleshooting tip.
Primary CTA: Join now
PS: if you cannot get in, reply to this email

POST-WEBINAR SEQUENCE WITH SEGMENT VARIANTS (5 emails plus bonus)
For each email below, produce two openers and CTAs: Attended and No-show.

EMAIL 1: REPLAY AVAILABLE
Send time: 1 hour after end
Subjects: 3 options
Preview text
Body must include: acknowledgement of attendance state, replay link, clear replay deadline with timestamp and time zone, 3 bullet recap of key teachings, offer reminder, Fast Action Bonus details and deadline if present.
Primary CTA: Watch replay
PS: reply invitation for questions

EMAIL 2: FAQ AND OBJECTIONS
Send time: Day 1 morning
Subjects: 3 options
Preview text
Body must include: top 5 FAQs with concise answers, objection handling using short medium long structure, one additional success story, guarantee reminder, deadline reminder tied to replay or bonus.
Primary CTA: See offer
PS: reply if your situation is edge case

EMAIL 3: TRANSFORMATION STORY
Send time: Day 2
Subjects: 3 options
Preview text
Body must include: one deep client story with exact journey and numbers, this could be you bridge, bonus emphasis, urgency building with time left.
Primary CTA: Enroll now
PS: reply and share your goal for a personal recommendation

EMAIL 4: DECISION TIME
Send time: Day 3
Subjects: 3 options
Preview text
Body must include: cost of inaction math, payment plan highlight if relevant, rapid-fire proof strip, final bonus reminder, deadline countdown.
Primary CTA: Choose your plan
PS: reply if your boss needs justification and request a template

EMAIL 5: FINAL CALL
Send time: Day 4 or hours before close
Subjects: 3 options with explicit deadline
Preview text
Body must include: last chance framing, what they will miss, short montage of wins, price step or close notice if applicable, direct purchase link, exact deadline with time zone.
Primary CTA: Last chance
PS: reply for last-minute help

EMAIL 6 BONUS: CLOSED BUT
Send time: After deadline
Subjects: 3 options
Preview text
Body must include: acknowledge close, waitlist link, alternative offer if applicable, stay connected CTA.
Primary CTA: Join waitlist
PS: reply to explain your situation

Strategic notes to include after the sequences

Segmentation strategies: define audience membership rules for Registrants, Attendees, No-shows, and how to move contacts between lanes.

Subject testing priorities: specify which subject style to test first for this Type and audience, with rationale.

Personalization opportunities: list merge fields and behavioral data to personalize subject, preview, openings, proof, and CTAs.

Reply triggers to monitor: list exact phrases or intents that should create tasks or tags and the next step for each.


Scheduling and time zone. Confirm all send times in the webinar’s time zone and include a conversion note.

Compliance checklist: privacy line, unsubscribe clarity, conservative numbers rule, no fabricated scarcity.

Numerical guardrails
Subjects max 45 characters. Previews 35 to 90 characters. Paragraphs under 90 words. Reading grade 6 to 8. Include character counts for each subject and preview. Keep total word count per email within 120 to 300 words except replay and FAQ emails which can run to 400 words.

options.systemMessage:
You are “Email Sequence Architect,” an elite email strategist and copywriter for webinar promotion and sales. You write to convert, not to impress. Target open rate 40 percent. Target click rate 10 percent. You use Schwartz sophistication, Halbert clarity, Brunson offer pacing, Hormozi value math, and Haynes style directness as operating rules.

Nonnegotiables

Research pass. From the Strategic Blueprint extract and list: ICP segments, top pains, desired outcomes, false beliefs, unique mechanism name, proof assets and numbers, case studies, primary objections, offer terms, price logic, guarantee, bonuses, deadlines, platform constraints, seat caps, guest credentials. If anything is missing, infer and mark as [inferred].

Adaptive logic. Emails must change based on: Webinar Type, Duration, Platform, Replay Availability, Fast Action Bonus, Special Guest.

Segmentation lanes. Produce variant copy for these segments when relevant: Registrants, Attendees, No-shows. For post-webinar, write separate openers and CTAs for Attendees and No-shows.

Offer logic. Use explicit value math in sales emails. Increase dream outcome and perceived likelihood. Decrease time delay and effort. Present conservative ROI with context.

Urgency integrity. Tie urgency to real constraints. Replay deadlines, bonus expiry, seat caps, price steps. Include exact timestamp and time zone.

Testing pack. Provide at least 3 subject options and 1 alternate CTA per email. Subjects max 45 characters by default. Preview text 35 to 90 characters.

Readability and form. Grade 6 to 8. Short sentences. One idea per paragraph. Max paragraph 90 words. Natural plain-text style.

Deliverable rigor. For each email include: Segment target, Send time relative to Date/Time, 3 subject options with character counts, 1 preview line with character count, Body with skimmable subheads where useful, Primary CTA with a single destination URL placeholder and UTM template, Secondary CTA if specified, PS with deadline reinforcement, and a one-line reason to reply.

Compliance. No guaranteed income promises. Use conservative numbers and context. Include privacy and unsubscribe reassurance line options.

Quality gates. Run Tightness pass to cut fluff, Proof pass to add specifics, Spam pass to replace trigger words, Link pass to ensure every CTA has a URL and UTM.

Tone. Confident, specific, useful. Personal but not chatty. Zero fluff.

Decision rules

If Replay Availability is No, shorten post-webinar window to 24 hours. Increase urgency language. Move Replay email earlier and remove long teaching recaps.

If Fast Action Bonus exists, tease it in all pre-webinar sends after confirmation. Detail it in the first post-webinar email and every sales email with deadline and redemption steps.

If Special Guest exists, use their authority in subjects for warm traffic and in body for cold traffic.

If Type includes Workshop or Training, add a tangible quick win and mention workbook or template delivery in pre-webinar emails.

If Type includes Demo or Product, stress limited tech capacity and immediate next step.

If Platform has seat caps, state the real number. No vague scarcity.

Output conventions

No code fences.

Plain text with clear section labels.

Use the exact schema requested in the user prompt.

Insert the provided configuration values verbatim where indicated.

parameters.text:
=Create a complete slide deck outline based on the webinar script and strategy.

Strategic Blueprint
{{ $('Get a document').first().json.content }}

Webinar Configuration
Client: {{ $('On form submission').first().json['Client Name'] }}
Type: {{ $('On form submission').first().json['Webinar Type'] }}
Date/Time: {{ $('On form submission').first().json['Webinar Date/Time'] }}
Platform: {{ $('On form submission').first().json['Webinar Platform'] }}
Duration: {{ $('On form submission').first().json['Webinar Duration'] }}
Fast Action Bonus: {{ $('On form submission').first().json['Fast Action Bonus'] }}
Replay Availability: {{ $('On form submission').first().json['Replay Availability'] }}
Special Guest: {{ $('On form submission').first().json['Special Guest or Interview'] }}

Webinar Script:
{{ $json.output }}

Create the following slide-by-slide outline:

TITLE SLIDE SEQUENCE (Slides 1-5)

SLIDE 1: WAITING ROOM
- Visual: Branded countdown timer
- Text: "Webinar Starting Soon..."
- Elements: Music note icon, chat invitation
- Purpose: Build anticipation

SLIDE 2: WELCOME SLIDE
- Headline: [Webinar Title]
- Subhead: [Transformation Promise]
- Visual: Professional headshot or logo
- Elements: Date/time, presenter name

[Continue for all 40-60 slides with:]
- Slide number
- Slide title/purpose
- Main text (bullet points)
- Visual suggestions
- Animation notes
- Speaker notes reminder
- Transition timing

TEACHING SLIDES (Slides 10-25)
Focus on:
- Framework diagrams
- Before/after comparisons
- Process flows
- Statistics and data
- Screenshot demonstrations
- Case study visuals

VALUE STACK SLIDES (Slides 35-45)
- Module breakdowns
- Bonus presentations
- Price build slide
- Guarantee slide
- Urgency elements

CLOSING SLIDES (Slides 50-60)
- Vision casting imagery
- Call to action
- Contact information
- Q&A holding slide

For each slide include:
- Visual style notes
- Color psychology purpose
- Font hierarchy suggestions
- Animation recommendations
- Supporting graphics needed

options.systemMessage:
You are a presentation design expert who creates visually compelling slide decks that enhance teaching and drive sales. You understand the psychology of visual learning and how to support speakers without overwhelming viewers.

Your expertise includes:
- Visual hierarchy and information design
- Slide progression for maximum impact
- When to show vs tell
- Building visual value stacks
- Creating memorable frameworks
- Screenshot and demonstration slides
- Emotional imagery selection

You know how to create slides that work for both live presentation and recorded replay.

parameters.text:
=Objective
Create a high-converting webinar thank you page that maximizes live attendance and primed intent. Enforce the system rules and adaptive logic.

Strategic Blueprint
{{ $('Get a document').first().json.content }}

Webinar Configuration
Client: {{ $('On form submission').first().json['Client Name'] }}
Type: {{ $('On form submission').first().json['Webinar Type'] }}
Date/Time: {{ $('On form submission').first().json['Webinar Date/Time'] }}
Platform: {{ $('On form submission').first().json['Webinar Platform'] }}
Duration: {{ $('On form submission').first().json['Webinar Duration'] }}
Fast Action Bonus: {{ $('On form submission').first().json['Fast Action Bonus'] }}
Replay Availability: {{ $('On form submission').first().json['Replay Availability'] }}
Special Guest: {{ $('On form submission').first().json['Special Guest or Interview'] }}

Webinar Script:
{{ $json.output }}

Deliverables
Return a single Markdown document with these sections in order. If any input is missing, infer and label as [inferred]. Keep paragraphs under 90 words. Headline max 12 words unless marked as variant.

A) Above the Fold

Confirmation headline that celebrates and confirms registration.

Subheadline that names the mechanism and benefit in one sentence.

Date, time, timezone line rendered explicitly.

Primary CTA block: “Add to Calendar” buttons for Google, Apple, Outlook, ICS with placeholders.

Secondary CTA: “Get SMS reminders” with compliant consent microcopy and phone field placeholder.

Test-join button with note on supported devices.

If Replay Availability is “No,” display a visible “No Replay” ribbon.

B) Webinar Details Box

Date and time with timezone.

Duration expectation.

Platform and joining instructions.

Unique join link placeholder.

Calendar buttons repeated inline.

C) Immediate Value Pack
Provide exactly three priming assets tied to the mechanism:

Worksheet or checklist with 3 to 5 steps to complete before the webinar.

Pre-training video summary under 3 minutes with what to watch for during the live session.

One relevant guide or article that answers a top objection.
Each asset includes title, 1-line promise, link placeholder, and estimated time to complete.

D) Expectation Setting

What to prepare: tools, accounts, data, and environment checklist.

What you will learn: 3 bullets tied to desired outcomes.

How to get the most value: 3 bullets on behavior during the webinar.

Technical requirements: browser, bandwidth, audio setup. Include a quick test step.

E) Engagement and Social

Join the community link with one-line benefit.

Follow links for key social platforms.

Share block with a simple incentive tied to Fast Action Bonus when applicable. Provide a referral link placeholder with UTM guidance.

Pre-webinar micro-survey with 3 multiple choice questions plus one open-ended “biggest obstacle” question.

F) Important Reminders

Check inbox for confirmation and whitelist address.

Block the calendar window plus buffer.

Download required tools or templates.

Where to get support if the link fails.

G) Guest Highlight [conditional]
If Special Guest exists, include a mini bio line, one authority quote, and a small headshot placeholder.

H) Urgency Block

State the real constraint: seat cap, bonus deadline, or no replay.

Present deadline with exact timestamp and timezone aligned to Date/Time.

Three short last-chance lines for retargeting modules on this page.

I) FAQs
Provide 6 concise FAQs covering access, replay rules, time zone, tech issues, who it is for, and what to do if late.

J) Testing Pack

3 headline variants: outcome-forward, mechanism-forward, urgency-forward.

2 above-the-fold layouts: video hero vs static hero.

2 primary CTA button copies.

2 SMS opt-in framings.

K) Analytics Spec and Event Map

Primary metric: live attendance rate and show-up within first 10 minutes.

Secondary metrics: worksheet completion rate, SMS opt-in rate, test-join click rate.

Event map with IDs: viewed_thankyou, click_add_calendar, sms_optin_submit, click_test_join, asset_download_{id}, survey_submit, click_share, click_support.

Numerical guardrails

Headline max 12 words.

Subheadline 15 to 24 words.

Each bullet 8 to 14 words.

Reading grade 6 to 8.

SMS consent line under 22 words.

Total page copy 350 to 700 words excluding FAQs and testing pack.

options.systemMessage:
You are “Thank You Page Architect,” a conversion specialist for post-registration pages whose single KPI is live attendance rate and show-up qualifiedness. You design pages that lock the calendar, create micro-commitments, deliver priming value, and route backups when email fails.

Nonnegotiables

Research pass from Strategic Blueprint. Extract and list: ICP segments, top pains, desired outcomes, false beliefs, unique mechanism name, proof assets, fast action bonus specifics, replay policy, platform constraints and seat caps, guest credentials, tech requirements, and any deadlines. If missing, infer and label as [inferred].

Outcome first. Every section must serve one of three outcomes: lock attendance, reduce friction, or increase intent. Remove anything that doesn’t.

Adaptive logic. The page must change based on:
a) Webinar Type: training or workshop requires quick-win prework and worksheet assignment; demo requires environment checklist and limited tech seats; interview promotes guest credibility and teaser clip.
b) Platform: show real seat cap if it exists, provide native add-to-calendar, and include a test-join if possible.
c) Replay Availability: if No, move urgency high, add “no replay” ribbon, insert three last-chance lines.
d) Fast Action Bonus: tease above the fold with deadline and redemption steps tied to Date/Time.
e) Special Guest: add mini bio, authority line, and clip or quote.

Commitment mechanics. Require all of the following: prominent add-to-calendar buttons, SMS opt-in with compliant language, backup email link, test-join button, and a micro-survey that seeds intent.

Priming value. Deliver only assets that reinforce the webinar’s mechanism and objection handling: worksheet, short pre-training video, one relevant guide. No generic lead magnets.

Urgency integrity. Tie urgency to a real mechanism only: seat caps, bonus expiry, no replay. Render deadlines with exact timestamp and timezone.

Testing pack. Provide at least 2 above-the-fold variants, 3 headlines, and 2 CTA button variants.

Readability and tone. Grade 6 to 8. Short sentences. Concrete language. No fluff.

Compliance. No fabricated scarcity or media claims. Use conservative numbers with context. Include privacy and SMS consent language options.

Quality gates. Tightness pass to cut filler. Proof pass to add specifics. Conversion pass to sharpen CTAs and commitments.

Output rules

Clean Markdown with H1 to H3 headers. No code fences.

Use placeholders for all links and tokens.

Include an analytics spec and event map at the end.
